headline.seo: New Rules Planned on School Vending Machines
headline.print_headline: New Guidelines Planned on School Vending Machines
headline.main: New Guidelines Planned on School Vending Machines

docs.abstract: Obama administration, in a continuation of its efforts to reduce childhood obesity, plans to set nationwide guidelines to promote healthy choices for foods that children buy at school outside of the cafeteria; many believe that new rules, which are likely to restrict sugar-, salt- and fat-laden snacks sold in vending machines, will trigger another fight between health advocates and the food industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration, in a continuation of its efforts to curb childhood obesity, plans to set nationwide guidelines to promote healthy choices in schools.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration, in a continuation of its efforts to curb childhood obesity, plans to set nationwide guidelines to promote healthy choices in schools.

headline.seo: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed in Circadian Rhythm Disturbances
headline.print_headline: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed for Range of Health Woes
headline.main: Aging of Eyes Is Blamed for Range of Health Woes

docs.abstract: Several recent studies point to the aging of the eye as an unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances, which can cause a range of health problems; as the eye ages, the lens gradually becomes more yellow, and the pupil narrows, allowing in less sunlight and causing the body to make errors in setting its internal clock.
docs.lead_paragraph: New research supports a largely unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances: the gradual yellowing of the lens and the narrowing of the pupil that come with age.
docs.snippet: New research supports a largely unrecognized culprit in circadian rhythm disturbances: the gradual yellowing of the lens and the narrowing of the pupil that come with age.

headline.seo: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters
headline.main: Nutrition: Dessert at Breakfast May Help Dieters

docs.abstract: Dr Daniela Jakubowicz study in journal Steroids finds that a low-calorie meal plan that includes dessert with breakfast may help dieters lose additional weight.
docs.lead_paragraph: A randomized study of 144 people put on low-calorie diets found that those given a high-carb, protein-rich breakfast with a dessert lost more weight and kept it off.
docs.snippet: A randomized study of 144 people put on low-calorie diets found that those given a high-carb, protein-rich breakfast with a dessert lost more weight and kept it off.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Still Wary of Diet Pill’s Side Effects
headline.print_headline: Side Effects Of Diet Pill Still Concern Regulators
headline.main: Side Effects of Diet Pill Still Concern Regulators

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration says it is worried about possible heart problems and birth defects with Qnexa, a weight-loss drug; committee of advisers to the FDA will consider again whether the drug, developed by Vivus, should be approved.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said it was worried about possible heart problems and birth defects with Qnexa, a weight-loss drug.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said it was worried about possible heart problems and birth defects with Qnexa, a weight-loss drug.

headline.seo: Diet Treatment, Already in Use, to Get F.D.A. Review
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Review Diet Treatment Once Rejected
headline.main: U.S. to Review Diet Treatment Once Rejected

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration will review a new diet pill consisting of a combination of two pills people are using in California to lose weight; the pill, Qnexa, was rejected by the FDA in 2010 amid safety concerns, but the manufacturer, Vivus, is presenting additional data to argue its case; doctors are allowed to prescribe the two approved components off-label as they see fit, which, taken together, are essentially the same medicine.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration will review a new diet pill consisting of a combination of two pills people are using in California to lose weight.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration will review a new diet pill consisting of a combination of two pills people are using in California to lose weight.

docs.lead_paragraph: A selected guide to events for, by and about children, teenagers and families.
